chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Z: Type
Y: Type
X: Type
I: Type
R1': relation2 X Y
R': relation2 X Y
S': relation2 Y Z
R1: relation2 X Y
R: relation2 X Y
S: relation2 Y Z
T: relation X
T': relation X
F: I -> relation2 X Y
F': I -> relation2 X Y

Goal:
incl R R' -> incl S S' -> incl (comp R S) (comp R' S')

Premises:
comp : forall X Y Z : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y Z -> relation2 X Z
incl : forall X Y : Type, relation (relation2 X Y)
relation2 = fun X Y : Type => X -> Y -> Prop : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments relation2 (_ _)%type_scope
relation = fun X : Type => relation2 X X : Type -> Type Arguments relation _%type_scope
ssrbool.onPhantom : forall (P : ?T -> Prop) (x : ?T), ssreflect.phantom Prop (P x) where ?T : [I : Type X : Type Y : Type Z : Type R' : relation2 X Y R1' : relation2 X Y S' : relation2 Y Z R : relation2 X Y R1 : relation2 X Y S : relation2 Y Z T' : relation X T : relation X F' : I -> relation2 X Y F : I -> relation2 X Y |- Type]
trans_incl = fun (H : incl R R') (x : Y) (y : X) (H0 : trans R x y) => H y x H0 : incl R R' -> incl (trans R) (trans R') Expanded type for implicit arguments trans_incl : incl R R' -> forall (x : Y) (y : X), trans R x y -> R' y x Arguments trans_incl _ [x y]
union2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
union : forall X Y I : Type, (I -> X -> Y -> Prop) -> relation2 X Y
eta2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
trans : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y X
union_st : forall X Y : Type, set (relation2 X Y) -> X -> Y -> Prop
plus : forall X : Type, relation X -> relation X
transitive : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
antisymmetric : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
reflexive : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
symmetric : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
eeq : forall X Y : Type, relation (relation2 X Y)
star_sind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> SProp), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
star_ind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> Prop), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
Inductive star (X : Type) (R : relation X) : relation X := star_refl : forall x : X, star R x x | S_star : forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z Arguments star [X]%type_scope Arguments star_refl [X]%type_scope Arguments S_star [X]%type_scope [R y] _ [z]
set = fun X : Type => X -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments set _%type_scope
S_star : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (y x z : X), R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z
InitialRing.gen_phiZ : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> BinNums.Z -> R
InitialRing.gen_phiPOS : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> BinNums.positive -> R
InitialRing.gen_phiPOS1 : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> BinNums.positive -> R

Ring_theory.pow_N : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> R -> BinNums.N -> R

Ring_theory.pow_pos : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> R) -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R
Ring_polynom.mkmult1 : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
Ring_polynom.mkmult_rec : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> R -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
Ring_polynom.mkmult_c_pos : forall R : Type, R -> forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> (R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> C -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
Field_theory.F_R : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Field_theory.field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req
Field_theory.AF_AR : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req
Field_theory.ring_S_inj : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall x y : R, req (radd rI x) (radd rI y) -> req x y
Field_theory.ropp_ext3_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req req) ropp
Field_theory.pow_pos_1 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall p : BinNums.positive, req (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul rI p) rI
Field_theory.F2AF : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req
Field_theory.pow_N_ext : forall (R : Type) (rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful eq req)) (Ring_theory.pow_N rI rmul)
Ring_theory.ARopp_zero : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> req (ropp rO) rO
Field_theory.gen_phiPOS_discr_sgn : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, ~ req (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS1 rI radd rmul p) rO) -> forall x y : BinNums.positive, ~ req (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS rI radd rmul x) (ropp (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS rI radd rmul y))
Field_theory.pow_pos_mul_r : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall (x : R) (p1 p2 : BinNums.positive), req (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul x (BinPos.Pos.mul p1 p2)) (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul x p1) p2)
Field_theory.gen_phiZ_inj : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, ~ req (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS1 rI radd rmul p) rO) -> forall x y : BinNums.Z, req (InitialRing.gen_phiZ rO rI radd rmul ropp x) (InitialRing.gen_phiZ rO rI radd rmul ropp y) -> x = y

```coq
intros H1 H2 x y H. unfold incl in H1, H2. unfold comp. unfold comp in H. destruct H as [x' [Hx'R' Hy'S']]. exists y. split.
- apply H2. apply Hy'S'.
- apply H1. apply Hx'R'.
Qed.```

original: intros H1 H2 x y H. unfold incl in H1, H2. unfold comp. unfold comp in H. destruct H as [x' [Hx'R' Hy'S']]. exists y. split. - apply H2. apply Hy'S'. - apply H1. apply Hx'R'.
